DataElement.preferredName: Inherited Genetic Disorder S-Beta Thalassemia java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Transmitted through genes from parents to offspring. (genome.gov):Genetic Diseases are diseases in which inherited genes predispose to increased risk.  The genetic disorders associated with cancer often result from an alteration or mutation in a single gene.  The diseases range from rare dominant cancer family syndrome to familial tendencies in which low-penetrance genes may interact with other genes or environmental factors to induce cancer.  Research may involve clinical, epidemiologic, and laboratory studies of persons, families, and populations at high risk of these disorders._A disorder characterized by the body"s inability to synthesize beta-globin chains, leading to the formation of abnormal hemoglobin and anemia. This inherited autosomal recessive blood disorder is caused by germline mutation of the HBB gene._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

Research may involve clinical, epidemiologic, and laboratory studies of persons, families, and populations at high risk of these disorders._A disorder characterized by the body's inability to synthesize beta-globin chains, leading to the formation of abnormal hemoglobin and anemia. This inherited autosomal recessive blood disorder is caused by germline mutation of the HBB gene.

The genetic disorders associated with cancer often result from an alteration or mutation in a single gene.  The diseases range from rare dominant cancer family syndrome to familial tendencies in which low-penetrance genes may interact with other genes or environmental factors to induce cancer. Concepts.definition: Transmitted through genes from parents to offspring. (genome.gov)

Genetic diseases are diseases in which inherited genes predispose to increased risk. The genetic disorders associated with cancer often result from an alteration or mutation in a single gene. The diseases range from rare dominant cancer family syndrome to familial tendencies in which low-penetrance genes may interact with other genes or environmental factors to induce cancer. Research may involve clinical, epidemiologic, and laboratory studies of persons, families, and populations at high risk of these disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the body's inability to synthesize beta-globin chains, leading to the formation of abnormal hemoglobin and anemia. This inherited autosomal recessive blood disorder is caused by germline mutation of the HBB gene.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by the body's inability to synthesize beta-globin chains, leading to the formation of abnormal hemoglobin and anemia. This inherited autosomal recessive blood disorder is caused by germline mutation of the HBB gene.
